studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated preliminary safety and pharmacokinetic data for GS-0976 in subjects with hepatic impairment.
Updated subject disposition and enrollment status for GS-9674 hepatic impairment study.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 1.6.2 - Rationale for Dose Selection of GS-0976
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Refined dose rationale based on updated exposure margins and NOAEL data from nonclinical studies.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Incorporation of emerging clinical and nonclinical data to support the safety and dosing rationale of the investigational products in subjects with advanced fibrosis and cirrhosis.
Update on the status of ongoing Phase 1 and Phase 2 studies (GS-US-426-3988 and GS-US-402-3885).

studyChanges.afterText: In the mild hepatic impairment cohort, 1 subject (10%) had a treatment-related AE of facial flushing... In the moderate hepatic impairment cohort, 3 subjects had Grade 3 lab abnormalities.
studyChanges.summary: Updated preliminary safety results for GS-0976 in hepatic impairment cohorts.

studyChanges.afterText: GS-0976 exposures in subjects with mild hepatic impairment (CP A) are expected to remain ≥22 and ≥105-fold lower than the GS-0976 exposures observed at the NOAELs.
studyChanges.summary: Updated exposure margin calculations relative to NOAEL for GS-0976 based on preliminary PK data.

studyChanges.afterText: As of 1 November 2017, a total of 37 subjects were enrolled and 36 subjects had completed study treatment.
studyChanges.summary: Updated enrollment and completion status for Study GS-US-402-3885.
